intro: Delissea subintegra, commonly known as the smoothleaf delissea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and finely divided, pinnately compound leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, which are typical of the carrot family. It is native to South Africa and thrives in well-drained soils in full sun. Delissea subintegra is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its delicate foliage and attractive floral display.
